Hovey — 9
The question seems to be this: Gould Pella in fact have behaved
to date much differently than he has, given hia slim majority?
It may well be that Pella has delayed meeting head-on some of the
most controversial Italian political Issues because he must depend on
the support of conservative Monarchists for survival. But he must
depend on that Monarchist support in part because the Social Democrats
— who are doing some of the criticizing — withheld their 19 Chamber
votes from Pella when his government was constituted.
It Is a sad political fact that the parties of the Center and
moderate Left — the pro-western parties that made up the former
Be Gasperi coalition — simply didn't get enough votes last June 7.
So, Pella for the time being must depend on the Monarchists. That may
account in part for his caution and for his desire to keep his
government as non-political as possible.
And even his critics concede that the country would be in a
genuine political crisis if Pella were to fall in the near future.
That helps account for the duration of his political honeymoon with
all parties. Including even those of the far Left.
But that honeymoon now seems to be drawing to a close. Pella
still seems to be very strong with the country. But political sniping
has begun in parliament, where the fate of the new government will be
decided.
The Communists and Left Socialists, who once praised Pella for
sounding what they called a "new tone of national dignity," have
discovered that the whole thing Is not so new after all.
